intro: Lecanthus peduncularis var. garhwalensis, commonly known as the Garhwal lecanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its habitat.
